page.title: 10Social life in Sebergham
page.content: Only a few householders in the area are without cars today and therefore people have little difficulty in travelling further afield than in the past. The inn at Goose Green is a popular meeting place and attracts people from the local towns. Fund raising events organised by the Church of England, village hall committee and Cumberland Farmers Fox- Hounds form the nucleus of entertain- ment for all. People entertain their friends in their homes and the Womens Institute, that meets monthly, also provides entertainment to the women. Those that do not both live and work in the area often enjoy a larger and more scattered circle of friends. Large private parties are organised for 21st birthdays, weddings and anniversaries and attract a large attendance.
